question_text:
Last week, Laura volunteered at the community clean-up event and earned 2 patches for her scout uniform. She spent 4 minutes sewing the patches onto her uniform. This week, Laura spent the week at the scout camp and earned another 6 patches.

If Laura sews at the same rate, how many minutes will she spend sewing her new patches onto her uniform?

 _ minutes
solution:
Last week, Laura spent 4 minutes sewing 2 patches. Write this as a rate.
$\frac{\text{4 minutes}}{\text{2 patches}$

Divide the numerator and denominator by 2 to find the unit rate.
$\frac{4 \text{ minutes} \div 2}{\text{2 patches} \div 2} = \frac{\text{2 minutes}}{\text{1 patch}}$

Laura sewed at a rate of 2 minutes per patch. You need to find how many minutes she will spend sewing 6 patches at the same rate. Write a proportion.
$\frac{2 \text{ minutes}}{\text{1 patch}} = \frac{? \text{ minutes}}{\text{6 patches}}$

Compare the denominators.
$\frac{2 \text{ minutes}}{\text{1 patch}} = \frac{? \text{ minutes}}{\text{6 patches}}$

To get from 1 to 6, multiply by 6. Multiply the numerator and denominator by 6 to find how many minutes Laura will spend sewing on her new patches.
$\frac{2 \text{ minutes} \cdot 6}{\text{1 patch}} \cdot 6 = \frac{12 \text{ minutes}}{\text{6 patches}}$
Laura will spend 12 minutes sewing her new patches onto her uniform.

question_text:
Mr. Thompson drew a rectangle on the chalkboard with a length to width ratio of 5 to 2. He asked students to draw a rectangle with the same ratio of length to width in their journals. Audrey plans to draw a rectangle with a width of 6 centimetres.

What length should Audrey's rectangle have?

 _ centimetres
solution:
Mr. Thompson's rectangle had a length to width ratio of 5 to 2. Audrey's rectangle will have width 6 centimetres, and you need to find the length. Write a proportion.
$\frac{5 \text{ cm}}{2 \text{ cm}} = \frac{? \text{ cm}}{6 \text{ cm}}$

Compare the denominators.
$\frac{5 \text{ cm}}{2 \text{ cm}} = \frac{? \text{ cm}}{6 \text{ cm}}$

To get from 2 to 6, multiply by 3. Multiply the numerator and denominator by 3 to find the length of Audrey's rectangle.
$\frac{5 \text{ cm} \cdot 3}{2 \text{ cm} \cdot 3} = \frac{15 \text{ cm}}{6 \text{ cm}}$
Audrey's rectangle should have length 15 centimetres.

question_text:
Last week, LeBron James practiced free throws and made 8 baskets. It took 37 minutes. This week, LeBron James continued training and made 12 baskets.

If LeBron maintains the same rate, how many minutes will it take?

 _ minutes
solution:
Last week, LeBron James took 37 minutes for 8 baskets. Write this as a rate.
$\frac{\text{37 minutes}}{\text{8 baskets}}$

Divide to find the unit rate.
$\frac{37 \text{ minutes} \div 8}{\text{8 baskets} \div 8} = \frac{\text{4.6 minutes}}{\text{1 basket}}$

LeBron works at a rate of 4.6 minutes per basket. Find how many minutes for 12 baskets.
$\frac{4.6 \text{ minutes}}{\text{1 basket}} = \frac{? \text{ minutes}}{\text{12 baskets}}$

Compare the denominators.
$\frac{4.6 \text{ minutes}}{\text{1 basket}} = \frac{? \text{ minutes}}{\text{12 baskets}}$

Multiply by 12 to find the time needed.
$\frac{4.6 \text{ minutes} \cdot 12}{\text{1 basket} \cdot 12} = \frac{56 \text{ minutes}}{\text{12 baskets}}$
It will take 56 minutes.

question_text:
Coach Williams drew a basketball court with a length to width ratio of 8 to 4. Stephen Curry wants to create a similar training diagram with a width of 15 units.

What length should Stephen's training diagram have?

 _ units
solution:
The ratio is 8 to 4. Stephen's width is 15 units. Set up a proportion.
$\frac{8 \text{ units}}{4 \text{ units}} = \frac{? \text{ units}}{15 \text{ units}}$

Cross multiply to solve.
$8 \times 15 = 4 \times ?$

Calculate the length.
$? = \frac{8 \times 15}{4} = \frac{120}{4} = 30$
The length should be 30 units.

question_text:
LeBron James practiced free throws and made 9 baskets in 52 minutes. Serena Williams practiced serves and completed 10 aces in 40 minutes.

If they both need to complete 9 more, how many minutes faster will Serena Williams finish?

 _ minutes
solution: LeBron James's rate: 52 minutes ÷ 9 = 5.8 minutes per item
Serena Williams's rate: 40 minutes ÷ 10 = 4.0 minutes per item
Time for LeBron James to complete 9: 9 × 5.8 = 52 minutes
Time for Serena Williams to complete 9: 9 × 4.0 = 36 minutes
Serena Williams finishes 16 minutes faster.

Time for Cristiano Ronaldo to complete 9: 9 × 5.0 = 45 minutes
Cristiano Ronaldo finishes 0 minutes faster.
